page.title: 07Marton in Cleveland
page.content: Marton is the birthplace of{Captain {James Cook}and lies to the south of Middlesbrough. It is cut in two by the Parkway,the A174,which separates the old village from the newer housing estates which serve as dormitory suburbs for Cleveland.{Stewart Park,}originally the private grounds of a house built for the iron master{H.W.F.Bolckow, contains a plinth marking the place where James Cook was born in 1728. Little of the old village remains and the old schoolhouse is now used as a kindergarten. The church, dedicated to St. Cuthbert, was founded in the 1100's and rebuilt during the reign of Queen Victoria. Its graveyard contains the memorials to Bolckow and Vaughan both local iron masters instrumental in the development of Middlesbrough.
